text: well I can't understand how you feel
planets these two friends rosemary and
Lin know just how debilitating the
menopause can be when Lin was suffering
the worst symptoms she was offered
hormone replacement therapy HRT by her
GP and had no hesitation he was very
very positive about it and he said it
was positive about it and that made me
feel positive because i hadn't at the
time heard anything to the contrary the
pain stopped my joints felt better I
slept better I was a happier person to
pull myself together a long time ago but
by the time the menopause hit rosemary
concerns had arisen about HRT and an
increased risk of cancer causing her to
think twice I lost a friend to cancer
last year who was only in her early
forties and she were very similar to me
in many ways and it brought home to me
the fragility of life and I didn't want
to do anything that was going to put me
at risk HRT prescriptions fell more than
a decade ago following a series of
studies that linked the treatment to an
increased risk for breast cancer and
heart disease now new guidelines from
the health watchdog nice call on doctors
to look again at the potential risks and
benefits of HRT they say HRT should be
offered to all women with debilitating
symptoms except those in high-risk
groups for example those with a strong
family linked to breast cancer and GPS
should have more confidence prescribing
the drug I think the time has come to
just redress that balance and to give
gp's the confidence to prescribe once
again and give women the confidence to
to seek help and not suffer in silence
which I think the moment a lot of them
are doing attitudes towards the
menopause have changed greatly from when
women were largely expected to cope with
the worst symptoms and some doctors
didn't believe it was a condition they
should treat it enormously increases the
workload on the doctor if he's going to
start not only dealing with diseases but
taking into account the overall health
and the well-being and the sex life and
the flushes and everything else of every
postmenopausal woman these new
guidelines don't say every woman should
use HRT but they do say they should be
offered and in
formed choice Dominic Hughes BBC News
